timeline.message:
Uses requery's window size

I want to look into requery's code to find the actual size of their
window.

I sent them a PR in order to add a getter which returns this window
size to us. Ideally, it would allow to remove those constants from
AnkiDroid code which are here only to copy their constants.

Note that, as I expected, we can't use a chunk whose size is the
window (I tested); that's because the window contains extra
informations. So I decreased the window size slightly in order to have
something reasonable.

timeline.author: mikehardy

timeline.bodyText: This isn't going to work now #3524 has gone in as it applies a decorator to the class
timeline.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText: We need to peek through the decorator I think? We need to be able to get the real implementation class so we have reasonable assurance that an otherwise known reflective access will work
replies.author: mikehardy
mikehardy

timeline.bodyText: This is going to slow down the app (reflection and exceptions are slow), ideally perform it once and cache the result
timeline.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText:
Probably not slow the app a lot. This method is used only twice: to load decks and models.
I'll do it anyway
replies.author: Arthur-Milchior

replies.bodyText: To be exhaustive, I should mention that those columns are loaded each time the collection is loaded, i.e. twice by sync, even for partial sync (unless you accept my PR which removes it)
replies.author: Arthur-Milchior

replies.bodyText: @Arthur-Milchior note that getWrapped() accessor does not exist yet on DatabaseChangeDecorator - it needs that too
replies.author: mikehardy

timeline.bodyText: Use doubles here, then convert back to an int at the end. (I think this will make it more accurate, but needs verification).
timeline.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText: I hate computer math. I think you're right, may not matter here but should be a habit.
replies.author: mikehardy

timeline.bodyText:
You need to check that mDb.getDatabase() can be cast to DatabaseChangeDecorator
It'd be best to extract a few variables out of the line for clarity.
Maybe extract getCursorWindowSize() so an early return is possible to make the code cleaner
